types.name: Query
types.description: The query root of TravelgateX's GraphQL interface.

fields.name: admin
fields.description: The admin query root of TravelgateX's for implementing GraphQL query.

fields.name: hotelX
fields.description: The hotelX product query root for implementing GraphQL query.

fields.name: mappea
fields.description: The Mappea product query root for implementing GraphQL query.

fields.name: paymentX
fields.description: The PaymentX product query root for implementing GraphQL query.

fields.name: stats
fields.description: The Stats product query root for implementing GraphQL query.

fields.name: search
fields.description: Available options for a given date and itinerary.
fields.deprecationReason: deprecated from 2017-11-21. You can find it in query at HotelX

fields.name: quote
fields.description: Returns the total price and cancellation policies of the Option selected in the previous step (Search).
fields.deprecationReason: deprecated from 2017-11-21. You can find it in query at HotelX

fields.name: booking
fields.deprecationReason: deprecated from 2017-11-21. You can find it in query at HotelX

fields.name: defaultSettings
fields.description: Reads defaultSettings of the given group
fields.deprecationReason: deprecated from 2017-11-21. You can find it in query at HotelX

fields.name: mapping
fields.description: Returns the mapping for a group, is necessary specify the group.
fields.deprecationReason: deprecated from 2017-11-21. You can find it in query at HotelX

types.name: AdminQuery
types.description: The admin query root of TravelgateX's GraphQL interface.

fields.name: organizations
fields.description: Organizations list; specify organization codes to filter organizations

fields.name: products
fields.description: Members list; specify member codes to filter members

fields.name: members
fields.description: Members list; specify member codes to filter members.

fields.name: groups
fields.description: Groups list; specify group codes to filter groups.

fields.name: apis
fields.description: Apis list; specify api codes to filter apis.

fields.name: resources
fields.description: Resources list; specify resource codes to filter resources.

fields.name: roles
fields.description: Roles list; specify role codes to filter roles.

fields.name: operations
fields.description: Operations list; specify operations codes to filter operations.

types.name: ID
types.description: The `ID` scalar type represents a unique identifier, often used to refetch an object or as key for a cache. The ID type appears in a JSON response as a String; however, it is not intended to be human-readable. When expected as an input type, any string (such as `"4"`) or integer (such as `4`) input value will be accepted as an ID.

types.name: Int
types.description: The `Int` scalar type represents non-fractional signed whole numeric values. Int can represent values between -(2^31) and 2^31 - 1.

types.name: String
types.description: The `String` scalar type represents textual data, represented as UTF-8 character sequences. The String type is most often used by GraphQL to represent free-form human-readable text.

types.name: DateTime
types.description:
The DateTime type represents DateTime values. A good example might be a transaction TimeSpan.
In queries or mutations, DateTime fields have to be specified in ISO 8601 format with enclosing double quotes: "2017-10-22T13:57:31.123Z".

fields.name: isTest
fields.description: Indicates if Access can be used for testing or not

fields.name: user
fields.description: User code to connect to supplier

fields.name: parameters
fields.description: List of parameters for additional information

fields.name: rateRules
fields.description: Business rule types for the Access

fields.name: isActive
fields.description: indicates whether a supplier is active

fields.name: provider
fields.description: instance to which this supllier is connected

fields.name: context
fields.description: Context where the Supplier belongs to

fields.name: accesses
fields.description: Accesses where the supplier is referenced

types.name: Provider
types.description: Temporary type to use only during SQL server's lifetime

fields.name: generic
fields.description: Supplier URL used for multiple methods.

types.name: URI
types.description:
The URI type represents a URI values. A good example mith be an Hotel Image URL.
In queries or mutations, URI fields have to be specified in RFC 3986, RFC 3987, and RFC 6570 (level 4) compliant URI string format with enclosing double quotes: "http:\\www.travelgatex.com".

types.name: Parameter
types.description: Parameters for additional information for the supplier's configuration.

fields.name: key
fields.description:
Contains the keyword/Id to identify a parameter.
This information is mandatory.

fields.name: value
fields.description:
Contains the parameter values.
This information is mandatory.

enumValues.name: PACKAGE
enumValues.description: The product can't be sold separately from another product attached to it, such as a flight.

enumValues.name: OLDER55
enumValues.description: Options that can only be sold to people who are 55 and older.

enumValues.name: OLDER60
enumValues.description: Options that can only be sold to people who are 60 and older.

enumValues.name: OLDER65
enumValues.description: Options that can only be sold to people who are 65 and older.

enumValues.name: CANARY_RESIDENT
enumValues.description: The rate CanaryResident is applicable to Canary Islands residents only.

enumValues.name: BALEARIC_RESIDENT
enumValues.description: The rate BalearicResident is applicable to Balearic Islands residents only.

enumValues.name: LARGE_FAMILY
enumValues.description: The rate largeFamily is applied to large families and is determined by each supplier

enumValues.name: HONEYMOON
enumValues.description: The rate honeymoon is applied to those who just got married and is determined by each supplier.

enumValues.name: PUBLIC_SERVANT
enumValues.description: The rate publicServant is applicable to public servants only.

enumValues.name: UNEMPLOYED
enumValues.description: The rate unemployed is applied to those without work.

enumValues.name: NORMAL
enumValues.description: The rate normal refers to options without RateRule

enumValues.name: NON_REFUNDABLE
enumValues.description: The rate non refundable is applied to non refundable options

fields.name: isActive
fields.description: Indicates whether a Client is active or inactive

fields.name: search
fields.description:
Available options of an hotel for a given date and itinerary. It does not filter different classes, times or
fares. It will always retrieve all results returned by the suppliers. The availability request is very straight
forward. It only requires the criteria of search (destination, travel dates and the number of pax in each room).
But you must preload the other fields in our system by complete the fields absents.

fields.name: quote
fields.description: Returns the total price and cancellation policies of the Option selected in the previous step (Search).

fields.name: booking
fields.description: Returns detailed information about books, you can indicated a list of locators or a range date.

fields.name: searchStatusService
fields.description: Returns status of the search service.

fields.name: quoteStatusService
fields.description: Returns status of the quote service.

fields.name: bookStatusService
fields.description: Returns status of the new booking service.

fields.name: cancelStatusService
fields.description: Returns status of the cancellation service.

fields.name: bookingStatusService
fields.description: Returns status of the booking service.

fields.name: mapping
fields.description: Returns map codes of a group. You can get hotel map, room map, and board map.

types.name: HotelCriteriaSearchInput
types.description:
Search criteria contains destination, travel dates and the number of pax in each room.
You must preload the other fields in our system by complete the fields absents.

inputFields.name: checkIn
inputFields.description:
Check-in date for booking
Format: YYYY-MM-DD

inputFields.name: checkOut
inputFields.description:
Check-out, booking date
Format: YYYY-MM-DD

inputFields.name: hotels
inputFields.description: Hotel Codes.

inputFields.name: destinations
inputFields.description: Destination codes.

inputFields.name: occupancies
inputFields.description:
For multi-room bookings, this array will contain multiple elements (rooms).
For each room you have to specify its own occupancy.

inputFields.name: language
inputFields.description: Language to be used in request

inputFields.name: currency
inputFields.description: Currency requested if supported by supplier

inputFields.name: nationality
inputFields.description: Nationality of the guest (use ISO3166_1_alfa_2)

inputFields.name: market
inputFields.description: Targeted zone, country or point-ofsale-to be used in request.

types.name: Date
types.description:
The Date type represents Date values. A good example might be a Hotel CheckIn Date.
In queries or mutations, DateTime fields have to be specified in ISO 8601 format with enclosing double quotes: "2017-10-22".

types.name: RoomInput
types.description: Occupancy for a room. It contains a list of pax ages.

inputFields.name: paxes
inputFields.description: Array of pax ages. The number of items in the array will indicate the pax occupancy.

types.name: PaxInput
types.description: Pax object that contains the pax age.

inputFields.name: age
inputFields.description: Pax age.

types.name: Language
types.description:
The Language type represents Language values. A good example might be a Hotel Description Language.
In queries or mutations, Language fields have to be specified in ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 format with enclosing double quotes "es".

types.name: Currency
types.description:
The Currenty type represents Currency values. A good example might be a Rate Price Currency.
In queries or mutations, Currency fields have to be specified in ISO 4217 format with enclosing double quotes "EUR".

types.name: Country
types.description:
The Country type represents Country values. A good example might be a Passenger Nationality.
In queries or mutations, Country fields have to be specified in ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 format with enclosing double quotes "ES".

types.name: HotelSettingsInput
types.description: Settings that you can edit for this avail. Values are loaded by default in our Back Office.

inputFields.name: context
inputFields.description: Indicates the context of the I/O codes (hotel, board, room and rates)

inputFields.name: useContext
inputFields.description:
Indicates if you want use context, or not, by default is true.
@deprecated(reason: "deprecated from 2017-12-12. Redundant.")

inputFields.name: connectUser
inputFields.description:
This field is occurs only if the authorization header is of the type JWT.. It is used to change the user that has been set by default in the preload.
@deprecated(reason: "deprecated from 2018-03-19. Redundant.")

inputFields.name: client
inputFields.description: This field is occurs only if the authorization header is of the type JWT.. It is used to change the user that has been set by default in the preload.

inputFields.name: group
inputFields.description: Group whose resources want to be used

inputFields.name: timeout
inputFields.description: Milliseconds before the connection is closed.

inputFields.name: auditTransactions
inputFields.description: Returns all the transactions exchanged with the supplier.

inputFields.name: businessRules
inputFields.description: Business rules

inputFields.name: suppliers
inputFields.description: Array of suppliers. Each one contains its own code, settings and accesses.

inputFields.name: plugins
inputFields.description: Array of plugins to execute.

inputFields.name: testMode
inputFields.description: This flag allows only the accesses checked as test. By default is production.

types.name: BusinessRulesInput
types.description: List of business rules to use as filter on the options.

inputFields.name: optionsQuota
inputFields.description: Options quota per search. Maximum numbers of options to be returned by the search query.

inputFields.name: businessRulesType
inputFields.description: Different business rules to filter the returned options.

enumValues.name: CHEAPER_AMOUNT
enumValues.description: The cheapest options is returned without exceeding the optionsQuota limit.

enumValues.name: ROOM_TYPE
enumValues.description: Groups the option by room type without exceeding the optionsQuota limit.

types.name: HotelXSupplierInput
types.description: Supplier object. Contains its own settings, code and access.

inputFields.name: settings
inputFields.description:
You can configure an special settings for any supplier. This level overwrites the avail settings level but not the
access settings level.

inputFields.name: code
inputFields.description:
Code that represents a supplier in our system.
This information is mandatory.

inputFields.name: accesses
inputFields.description: Array of accesses that can overwrite an existing access information or include a new access for this avail.

types.name: SettingsBaseInput
types.description: Contains the time out and business rules of a supplier or an access.

inputFields.name: timeout
inputFields.description: Milliseconds before the connection is closed.

inputFields.name: auditTransactions
inputFields.description: Specifies if transactions exchanged with the supplier have to be logged or not.

inputFields.name: businessRules
inputFields.description: Business rules

types.name: HotelXAccessInput
types.description:
AccessInput overwrites an existent access in our Back Office or creates a new
one to be used in this search query only. An access object contains its own code, configuration and settings.

inputFields.name: accessId
inputFields.description:
The accessID used to identify the existing access in our Back Office in order to
overwrite it. Acts as an identifier in this search. It can either exist or not.

inputFields.name: configuration
inputFields.description: Information required to access the supplier's system.

inputFields.name: settings
inputFields.description: You can configure an special settings for any access. This level overwrites the search and supplier settings levels.

types.name: ConfigurationInput
types.description: The information and credentials required to access the supplier’s system.

inputFields.name: username
inputFields.description: User name for the connection.

inputFields.name: password
inputFields.description: Password for the connection

inputFields.name: urls
inputFields.description: URL or endpoint for the connection.

inputFields.name: parameters
inputFields.description: List of parameters with additional required information.

inputFields.name: markets
inputFields.description: Source Markets allowed for the Access

inputFields.name: rateRules
inputFields.description: RateRules allowed for the access.

inputFields.name: search
inputFields.description: Specific URL for Availability method.

inputFields.name: quote
inputFields.description: Specific URL for Reservation method.

inputFields.name: book
inputFields.description: Specific URL for Valuation method.

inputFields.name: generic
inputFields.description: Supplier URL used for multiple methods.

inputFields.name: key
inputFields.description:
Contains the keyword/Id to identify a parameter.
This information is mandatory.

inputFields.name: value
inputFields.description:
Contains the parameter values.
This information is mandatory.

inputFields.name: step
inputFields.description: Indicates where the plugin will be executed.

inputFields.name: pluginsType
inputFields.description: Indicates the plugin that will be executed.

enumValues.name: REQUEST
enumValues.description: Plugins executed after Buyer requests message to HotelX

enumValues.name: REQUEST_ACCESS
enumValues.description: Plugins executed before sending request to Supplier using Access and after Accesses have been calculated

enumValues.name: RESPONSE_OPTION
enumValues.description: Plugins executed after Supplier responds message. For every option returned

enumValues.name: RESPONSE_ACCESS
enumValues.description: Plugins executed after all Access options has been responded

enumValues.name: RESPONSE
enumValues.description: Plugins executed before HotelX responds message to to Buyer

inputFields.name: type
inputFields.description: type of the plugins to execute

inputFields.name: name
inputFields.description: name of plugin to execute

inputFields.name: parameters
inputFields.description: Plugin's parameters

enumValues.name: PRE_STEP
enumValues.description:
PRE_STEP is the first plugin that a step will execute, allows a full range of operations:
split arrays, join arrays, modify object values, add or remove object instances

enumValues.name: HOTEL_MAP
enumValues.description: HOTEL_MAP allows to match Seller and Buyer hotel codes based on contexts

enumValues.name: BOARD_MAP
enumValues.description: BOARD_MAP allows to match Seller and Buyer board codes based on contexts

enumValues.name: ROOM_MAP
enumValues.description: ROOM_MAP allows to match Seller and Buyer room codes based on contexts

enumValues.name: CURRENCY_CONVERSION
enumValues.description: CURRENCY_CONVERSION allows to match Seller and Buyer hotel codes based on contexts

enumValues.name: MARKUP
enumValues.description: MARKUP allows to apply markup over price

enumValues.name: AGGREGATION
enumValues.description: AGGREGATION allows to aggregate multiple supplier options

enumValues.name: POST_STEP
enumValues.description:
POST_STEP is the last plugin that a step will execute, allows a full range of operations:
split arrays, join arrays, modify object values, add or remove object instances

types.name: FilterInput
types.description:
Filter that selects the filter criteria which will be used in this availability. Currently you can only choose the accesses.
You must choose one of them, include or exclude, or the other alternative isn't specified anything.
If input both, you will receive a validation error that indicates this error.

inputFields.name: access
inputFields.description: You can specify one of the filters or any of them. In this latter case, all the configurated accesses will be executed.

inputFields.name: rateRules
inputFields.description: If requested, only options with the specified rateRules will be returned

types.name: AccessFilterInput
types.description:
Include *OR* exclude accesses in this specific search query. If not specified, default accesses will be used.
Only one list (includes or excludes) *MUST* be used.

inputFields.name: includes
inputFields.description: These Access IDs will overwrite the default configuration. Only the IDs on this list will be used in the search query.

inputFields.name: excludes
inputFields.description: These Access IDs will overwrite the default configuration. The IDs on this list will be excluded from the search query.

types.name: RateRulesFilterInput
types.description: If requested, only options with the specified rateRules will be returned

inputFields.name: includes
inputFields.description: if includes not nil: only options without rate rules and options with rate rules found in includes will be returned

inputFields.name: excludes
inputFields.description: if excludes not nil: only options without rate rules and options with rate rules that haven't been sent in excludes will be returned

types.name: HotelSearch
types.description: Results from Avail Hotel; contains all the available options for a given date and itinerary

fields.name: context
fields.description: Indicates the context of the response.

fields.name: auditData
fields.description: Data sent and received in the supplier's native format.

fields.name: options
fields.description: List of options returned according to the request.

fields.name: warnings
fields.description: Potentially harmful situations or errors that won't force the service to abort

fields.name: auditData
fields.description: Data sent and received in the supplier’s original format.

fields.name: errors
fields.description: Errors that lead the service to stop

fields.name: warnings
fields.description: Potentially harmful situations or errors that do not stop the service

fields.name: process
fields.description: Process time. Contains communication time, parse time and plugin time.

fields.name: duration
fields.description: Difference between start and end in miliseconds

types.name: Float
types.description: The `Float` scalar type represents signed double-precision fractional values as specified by [IEEE 754](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IEEE_floating_point).

types.name: AuditData
types.description: Data sent and received in the supplier’s native format.

fields.name: timeStamp
fields.description: Time when the request has been processed.

types.name: CriteriaSearch
types.description: Search criteria contains destination, travel dates and the number of pax in each room.

fields.name: checkIn
fields.description:
Check-in date for booking
Format: YYYY-MM-DD

fields.name: hotels
fields.description: Contains the list of hotels's ID

fields.name: occupancies
fields.description:
For multi-room bookings, this array will contain multiple elements (rooms).
For each room you have to specify its own occupancy.

fields.name: language
fields.description: Language to be used in request

fields.name: currency
fields.description: Currency requested if supported by supplier

fields.name: market
fields.description: Targeted zone, country or point-ofsale-to be used in request.

types.name: RoomCriteria
types.description: Occupancy for a room. It contains a list of pax ages.

fields.name: paxes
fields.description: Array of pax ages. The number of items in the array will indicate the pax occupancy.

types.name: Pax
types.description: Specifies the age pax. The range of what is considered an adult, infant or baby is particular to each supplier.

types.name: HotelOptionSearch
types.description: An option includes hotel information, meal plan, total price, conditions and room description

fields.name: hotelCode
fields.description: Code of the hotel in the context selected.

fields.name: boardCode
fields.description: Code of the board in the context selected.

fields.name: paymentType
fields.description: Indicates the payment type of the option returned. Possible options: Merchant, Direct, Card Booking, Card check in and Mixed.

fields.name: status
fields.description: The possible values in status in response are Available (OK) or On Request (RQ).

fields.name: occupancies
fields.description: List of occupancies for the request

fields.name: rooms
fields.description: List of rooms of the option returned.

fields.name: price
fields.description: Specifies the prices (Gross, Net and Amount) of the option returned.

fields.name: supplements
fields.description: List of supplements of the option returned.

fields.name: surcharges
fields.description: List of surcharges of the option returned.

fields.name: rateRules
fields.description: Specifies rate rules of the option returned.

fields.name: cancelPolicy
fields.description: Specifies cancel policies of the option returned.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Indicates the id to be used on Quote as key

enumValues.name: MERCHANT
enumValues.description: The payment is managed by the supplier.

enumValues.name: DIRECT
enumValues.description: The payment is made straight to the actual payee, without sending it through an intermediary or a third party.

enumValues.name: CARD_BOOKING
enumValues.description: The payment is managed by the supplier. The payment is effectuated at the time of booking.

enumValues.name: CARD_CHECK_IN
enumValues.description: The payment is managed by the supplier. The payment is effectuated at check in in the hotel.

enumValues.name: OK
enumValues.description: The status of the avail is available

enumValues.name: RQ
enumValues.description: The status of the avail is On request

fields.name: id
fields.description: Unique ID room in this option.

fields.name: paxes
fields.description: List of pax of this occupancy.

types.name: Room
types.description: Contains the room information of the option returned.

fields.name: refundable
fields.description: Identifies if the room is refundable or not.

fields.name: units
fields.description: Number of rooms available with the same type.

types.name: Price
types.description:
Price indicates the value of the room/option.
Supplements and/or surcharges can be included into the price, and will be verified with nodes Supplements/Surcharges.

fields.name: currency
fields.description:
Currency code indicating which currency should be paid.
This information is mandatory.

fields.name: binding
fields.description:
It indicates if the price indicated in the gross must be respected.
That is, the customer can not sell the room / option at a price lower than that established by the supplier.
This information is mandatory.

fields.name: net
fields.description:
Indicates the net price that the customer must pay to the supplier.
This information is mandatory.

fields.name: gross
fields.description: Indicates the retail price that the supplier sells to the customer.

fields.name: exchange
fields.description:
Provides information about the currency of original, and its rate applied over the results returned by the Supplier.
This information is mandatory.

fields.name: markups
fields.description: Informs markup applied over supplier price.

types.name: Exchange
types.description: Provides information about the currency of original, and its rate applied over the results returned by the Supplier.

fields.name: currency
fields.description: Provide information about the currency of origin

fields.name: rate
fields.description: Provides information about the rate applied over results

types.name: Markup
types.description: Informs markup applied over supplier price.

fields.name: currency
fields.description:
Currency code indicating which currency should be paid.
This information is mandatory.

fields.name: binding
fields.description:
It indicates if the price indicated in the gross must be respected.
That is, the customer can not sell the room / option at a price lower than that established by the supplier.
This information is mandatory.

fields.name: net
fields.description:
Indicates the net price that the customer must pay to the supplier plus the markup.
This information is mandatory.

fields.name: gross
fields.description: Indicates the retail price that the supplier sells to the customer plus the markup.

fields.name: exchange
fields.description:
Informs about the currency of origin, and the rate applied over result.
This information is mandatory.

fields.name: rules
fields.description: Breakdown of the applied rules for a markup

types.name: MarkupRuleType
types.description: Indicates what type of value is the markup, by percentage or is an import.

enumValues.name: PERCENT
enumValues.description: Indicates the percentage applied by a rule.

enumValues.name: IMPORT
enumValues.description: Indicates the exact amount applied by a rule.

fields.name: effectiveDate
fields.description: Start date in which the price becomes effective.

fields.name: count
fields.description: Indicates number of beds in a room

fields.name: shared
fields.description: Specifies if the bed is shared or not

types.name: RatePlan
types.description: Information about the rate of the option returned.

fields.name: effectiveDate
fields.description: Start date in which the rate becomes effective.

types.name: Supplement
types.description: Supplement that it can be or its already added to the option returned. Contains all the information about the supplement.

fields.name: supplementType
fields.description: Indicates the supplement type. Possible types: Fee, Ski_pass, Lessons, Meals, Equipment, Ticket, Transfers, Gla, Activity or Null.

fields.name: chargeType
fields.description:
Indicates the charge types. We need to know whether the supplements have to be paid when the consumer gets to the hotel or beforehand.
Possible charge types: Include or Exclude.
when include: this supplement is mandatory and included in the option's price
when exclude: this supplement is not included in the option's price

fields.name: mandatory
fields.description:
Indicates if the supplement is mandatory or not. If mandatory, this supplement will be applied to this option
if the chargeType is excluded the customer will have to pay it directly at the hotel

fields.name: durationType
fields.description: Specifies the duration type. Possible duration types: Range (specified dates) or Open. This field is mandatory for PDI.

fields.name: quantity
fields.description: Indicates the quantity of field in the element "unit".

fields.name: unit
fields.description: Indicates the unit type. Possible unit types: Day or Hour.

fields.name: effectiveDate
fields.description: Indicates the effective date of the supplement.

fields.name: expireDate
fields.description: Indicates the expire date of the supplement.

enumValues.name: SKI_PASS
enumValues.description: A ticket or pass authorizing the holder to ski in a certain place or resort.

enumValues.name: LESSONS
enumValues.description: Lessons of any type that the costumer can take.

enumValues.name: MEALS
enumValues.description: Supplement of a determined meal plan.

enumValues.name: EQUIPMENT
enumValues.description: Extra equipment for a specific purpose.

enumValues.name: TICKET
enumValues.description: Admission to some service.

enumValues.name: TRANSFERS
enumValues.description: Transfers used by the costumer.

enumValues.name: GALA
enumValues.description: Gala: A festive occasion, celebration or special entertainment.

enumValues.name: ACTIVITY
enumValues.description: Activities that the costumer can do.

enumValues.name: INCLUDE
enumValues.description: The charge is included.

enumValues.name: EXCLUDE
enumValues.description: The charge is excluded.

enumValues.name: RANGE
enumValues.description: Date range is set.

enumValues.name: OPEN
enumValues.description: Not restricted by date.

enumValues.name: DAY
enumValues.description: Day

enumValues.name: HOUR
enumValues.description: Hour

types.name: Surcharge
types.description: Surcharge that it can be or it is already added to the option returned. Contains all the information about the surcharge.

fields.name: chargeType
fields.description:
Indicates the charge types. We need to know whether the supplements have to be paid when the consumer gets to the hotel or beforehand.
Possible charge types: Include or Exclude.
when include: this surcharge is mandatory and included in the option's price
when exclude: this surcharge is not included in the option's price

fields.name: mandatory
fields.description:
Indicates if the surcharge is mandatory or not. If mandatory, this surcharge will be applied to this option
if the chargeType is excluded the customer will have to pay it directly at the hotel

fields.name: refundable
fields.description: Indicates if the option is refundable or non-refundable

fields.name: hoursBefore
fields.description: Cancellation fees applicable X number of hours before the check-in date

fields.name: penaltyType
fields.description: Type of penalty; this can be Nights, Percent or Import

fields.name: currency
fields.description: Currency used in the cancellation policy

enumValues.name: NIGHTS
enumValues.description: Indicates the number of nights to be penalized.

enumValues.name: PERCENT
enumValues.description: Indicates the percentage to pay based on the option price.

enumValues.name: IMPORT
enumValues.description: Indicates the exact amount payable.

fields.name: distribute
fields.description: Extra information from the distribution layer
fields.deprecationReason: You can find it in distribution AddOn

fields.name: distribution
fields.description: Extra information from the distribution layer

types.name: JSON
types.description:
The JSON type makes sure that it is actually valid JSON and returns the value as a parsed JSON object/array instead of a string.
In queries or mutations, JSON fields have to be specified with enclosing double quotes. Special characters have to be escaped: "{\"int\": 1, \"string\": \"value\"}".

enumValues.name: OK
enumValues.description: The reservation was completed with no problems

enumValues.name: KO
enumValues.description: The status of the booking is KO

enumValues.name: ON_REQUEST
enumValues.description:
The reservation was completed but the product is still not available, so the reservation goes into a waiting list.
It is the client’s responsibility to check if the booking is OK

enumValues.name: CANCELLED
enumValues.description: The status of the booking is cancelled

enumValues.name: UNKNOWN
enumValues.description:
The reservation was completed but due to a supplier error or a timeout, the reservation status is unknown.
It is the client’s responsibility to check if the booking is OK

fields.name: url

types.name: Search
types.description:
Available options for a given date and itinerary. It does not filter different classes, times or
fares. It will always retrieve all results returned by the suppliers. The availability request is very straight
forward.

fields.name: hotel
fields.description:
Available options of an hotel for a given date and itinerary. It does not filter different classes, times or
fares. It will always retrieve all results returned by the suppliers. The availability request is very straight
forward. It only requires the criteria of search (destination, travel dates and the number of pax in each room).
But you must preload the other fields in our system by complete the fields absents.
fields.deprecationReason: deprecated from 2017-11-21. You can find it in query at HotelX

types.name: DeltaPriceInput
types.description:
Input delta price, indicates price variation permitted by the client
An error will be returned if the new price does not abide to DeltaPrice. If DeltaPrice is not sent and the integration implements it, we assume that the price range is 0 and the process will continue 
(price is lower or equal to the price showed in valuation).
This field is implemented if it’s native to the supplier or if another availability/valuation request needs to be done in Reservation. In case the supplier blocks the option in valuation, reservation 
will be done automatically in reservation method.

inputFields.name: amount
inputFields.description: The amount in the currency returned by the option that will be accepted by the client to be higher than the valuation price.

inputFields.name: percent
inputFields.description: The percentage accepted by the client to be higher than the valuation price.

inputFields.name: applyBoth
inputFields.description:
Depending on the value of applyBoth:
applyBoth = false: Indicates that one of the conditions (amount or percentage) has to meet the criteria before reservation.
applyBoth = true: Indicates that the new price cannot exceed the amount or percentage indicated by the client.

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.

types.name: __Type
types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name and description, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields` and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

types.name: __Field
types.description: Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

types.name: __InputValue
types.description: Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and optionally a default value.

fields.name: defaultValue
fields.description: A GraphQL-formatted string representing the default value for this input value.

types.name: __EnumValue
types.description: One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned in a JSON response as a string.

types.name: __Directive
types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL's execution behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information to the executor.

fields.name: onOperation
fields.deprecationReason: Use `locations`.

fields.name: onFragment
fields.deprecationReason: Use `locations`.

fields.name: onField
fields.deprecationReason: Use `locations`.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a __DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a query operation.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a mutation operation.

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a subscription operation.

enumValues.name: FIELD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment definition.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment spread.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an inline fragment.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a schema definition.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a scalar definition.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an object type definition.

enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field definition.

enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an argument definition.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an interface definition.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a union definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM_VALUE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum value definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object type definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object field definition.

types.name: Amenity
types.description: An Amenity is defined as something intended to make life more pleasant or comfortable for people. Examples include: swimming pools, shopping centers, etc.

fields.name: boardCode
fields.description: Code of the hotel in the Supplier selected

fields.name: categoryCode
fields.description: Code of the hotel based on the Supplier selected

types.name: Coordinates
types.description: Geographical coordinates corresponding to a location.

types.name: Description
types.description: Object description indicates the type and the description about something.

fields.description: Indicates if you can search by destination

fields.name: destinationLeaf
fields.description: Returns destination leafs of the destination.

fields.name: closestDestinations
fields.description: Closest destinations, indicates destinations in proximity

fields.name: type
fields.description: Indicates destination type, zone or city

fields.name: hotelName
fields.description: Name of the hotel in the Supplier selected.

fields.description: Hotel category (for example number of stars).

fields.description: Indicates that the Hotel has an Exclusive Deal.

fields.name: location
fields.description: Indicates the location of the hotel

fields.name: contact
fields.description: Contact cotains information about hotel contact.

fields.name: type
fields.description: Indicates the type of the media.

enumValues.description: Price without deductions.

enumValues.name: NET
enumValues.description: Price after deducting all discounts and rebates.

enumValues.name: AMOUNT
enumValues.description: Final quantity. Sum of multiple quantities.

enumValues.description: A ticket or pass authorizing the holder to ski in a certain place or resort. Gross.

enumValues.name: streetAddress
enumValues.description: Configure address with option `useFullAddress`

enumValues.name: money
enumValues.description: Sum of money. Configure with options `minMoney`/`maxMoney` and 'decimalPlaces'.

enumValues.name: pastDate
enumValues.description: Configure date format with option `dateFormat`

enumValues.name: futureDate
enumValues.description: Configure date format with option `dateFormat`

enumValues.name: recentDate
enumValues.description: Configure date format with option `dateFormat`

enumValues.name: imageUrl
enumValues.description:
An image url. Configure image with options: `imageCategory`,
`imageWidth`, `imageHeight` and `randomizeImageUrl`

enumValues.name: avatarUrl
enumValues.description: An URL for an avatar

enumValues.name: email
enumValues.description: Configure email provider with option: `emailProvider`

enumValues.name: colorHex
enumValues.description: Configure color with option: `baseColor`

enumValues.name: password
enumValues.description: Configure password with option `passwordLength`

enumValues.name: lorem
enumValues.description: Lorem Ipsum text. Configure size with option `loremSize`

inputFields.name: useFullAddress
inputFields.description: Only for type `streetAddress`

inputFields.name: minMoney
inputFields.description: Only for type `money`

inputFields.name: maxMoney
inputFields.description: Only for type `money`

inputFields.name: decimalPlaces
inputFields.description: Only for type `money`

inputFields.name: imageWidth
inputFields.description: Only for type `imageUrl`

inputFields.name: imageHeight
inputFields.description: Only for type `imageUrl`

inputFields.name: imageCategory
inputFields.description: Only for type `imageUrl`

inputFields.name: randomizeImageUrl
inputFields.description: Only for type `imageUrl`

inputFields.name: emailProvider
inputFields.description: Only for type `email`

inputFields.name: passwordLength
inputFields.description: Only for type `password`

inputFields.name: loremSize
inputFields.description: Only for type `lorem`

inputFields.name: dateFormat
inputFields.description:
Only for types `*Date`. Example value: `YYYY MM DD`.
[Full Specification](http://momentjs.com/docs/#/displaying/format/)

inputFields.name: baseColor
inputFields.description: Only for type `colorHex`. [Details here](https://stackoverflow.com/a/43235/4989887)

directives.name: skip
directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the `if` argument is true.

directives.name: include
directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the `if` argument is true.

directives.name: deprecated
directives.description: Marks an element of a GraphQL schema as no longer supported.

args.name: reason
args.description: Explains why this element was deprecated, usually also including a suggestion for how to access supported similar data. Formatted in [Markdown](https://daringfireball.net/projects/markdown/).
